items.title: Hong Kong media mogul Jimmy Lai sentenced to 20 years in landmark case

items.title: Christchurch terrorist gives testimony in NZ appeal court as he attempts to vacate guilty pleas over 2019 attack
items.summary: The convicted Christchurch terrorist and murderer is giving testimony in the New Zealand Court of Appeal as he seeks to vacate his guilty pleas over his 2019 attack on two mosques.

items.title: Jon Kudelka, Walkley-winning Tasmanian cartoonist, dies from brain cancer
items.summary: Award-winning Tasmanian cartoonist Jon Kudelka dies after being diagnosed with brain cancer in 2024.

items.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Lindsey Vonn hailed as 'idol' by downhill rivals after Milano Cortina crash
items.summary: Lindsey Vonn's 2026 Winter Olympic Games ended in disaster, but her teammates and rivals have heaped praise on the three-time Olympic medallist.

items.title: HESTA CEO Debby Blakey resigns after superannuation administration outage
items.summary: HESTA's boss is calling it quits after 11 years in the role. Her exit follows an outage that left members unable to access their accounts.

items.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 3, Monday, February 9
items.summary: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

items.title: Search ends for 'very loved' Gold Coast fisherman Ash Haigh after almost five days lost at sea
items.summary: Queensland Police has suspended the cross-border search for missing Gold Coast fisherman Ash Haigh after an extensive air and sea operation found no signs of life, with his sister describing him as a "very loved" family man.

items.title: Backyard pods won't fix the housing crisis but they signal a shift
items.summary: Australia's biggest hardware retailer has started selling tiny homes. Are backyard pods the answer to a national housing crisis?

items.title: Darkwaves research allows scientists to measure impact of 'underwater blackouts' on marine life
items.summary: For the first time a group of international scientists have measured the impact of what happens to marine life when the lights go out underwater.

items.title: 'Punitive' bail law amendments have increased and First Nations people are affected
items.summary: A study has found increasing "punitive" bail law amendments are negatively affecting First Nations people.

items.title: Cyclists slam 'nightmare' shared path at new Sydney Fish Market
items.summary: The decision to put a shared bike path in front of the new Sydney Fish Market is causing a clash between commuter cyclists and visitors to the site, riders say.

items.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Lindsey Vonn breaks her leg, Breezy Johnson breaks her gold medal — quick hits from day two
items.summary: US great Lindsey Vonn breaks her leg, and her compatriot breaks her gold medal as Tess Coady sneaks through to the final after a nervous wait on the bubble. Here are the quick hits from the Winter Olympics.

items.title: Tasmanian minister Nick Duigan to go on medical leave for heart surgery
items.summary: Tasmanian minister Nick Duigan will take extended medical leave to undergo heart surgery, the state government has announced.

items.title: Aussie stars as Seahawks use ferocious defence to claim Super Bowl win
items.summary: The Seattle Seahawks overawe the New England Patriots in Super Bowl LX as punter Michael Dickson becomes the second ever Australian NFL champion.

items.title: Kimberley cotton hits record high in first season with new processing gin in Kununurra
items.summary: From farm to fabric, West Australian cotton growers are finally able to grow, process and export record amounts of cotton locally.

items.title: Liberals despair at prospect of 'non-existence' and weigh leadership change after catastrophic Newspoll
items.summary: Sussan Ley could face a challenge to her leadership from Angus Taylor this week after a disastrous opinion poll showed the Coalition parties falling further behind One Nation.

items.title: Court appoints statutory trustee to sell rundown Rockhampton Plaza Hotel
items.summary: After years of complaints from local authorities, a judge has ordered the sale of the property which sits surrounded by temporary fencing, with smashed windows and timber boards nailed across its seven-storey façade.

items.title: Deua River Valley and Cobargo still rebuilding six years after Black Summer bushfires
items.summary: Residents who lived through the 2019-20 bushfires on the NSW South Coast say this summer's fires triggered traumatic memories, and highlighted the recovery and resilience projects that remain unfinished.

items.title: Explain the Internet: Why Wuthering Heights is one of the year's most controversial adaptations
items.summary: Days away from the release of Emerald Fennell's highly anticipated adaptation of Emily Brontë's classic novel, critics and fans alike are still fighting about text fidelity in the comments.

items.title: As AFL prepares to reboot State of Origin, there are hopes it can capture the imagination of a new generation
items.summary: The AFL is about to reboot the State of Origin concept, with the clash between Western Australia and Victoria at Perth Stadium next Saturday — on Valentine's Day — set to show if there's any love left for the idea.

items.title: Mother claims missed warning signs in NT hospital led to baby's lifelong disabilities
items.summary: Mia Pilbrow is taking legal action against a Northern Territory hospital and calling for the territory to adopt tailored pre-term labour guidelines, after medical staff sent her home seven times during her pregnancy, repeatedly assuring her the baby was fine.

items.title: Israeli President Isaac Herzog tells Sydney event antisemitism has been 'festering' in Australia
items.summary: Isaac Herzog was invited by the governor-general and prime minister to join the Jewish community grieving the loss of life in the December 14 massacre of mostly Jewish Australians at a Hanukkah event.

items.title: Extreme heat returning for south-east Queensland before weekend showers
items.summary: The Bureau of Meteorology is forecasting "locally severe heatwave conditions" from Tuesday, culminating in a maximum of 35 degrees in Brisbane on Thursday.

items.title: Bullying surges in ACT public schools as parents, teachers speak out
items.summary: Reports of bullying in ACT public schools have risen sharply in four years. Parents and teachers say children are paying the price, and the system is not coping.

items.title: Green turtle released from Taronga Zoo's wildlife hospital after horror injury
items.summary: After surviving one of the worst fishing line injuries vet Rebecca Robey had ever seen, Terry the turtle has been set free.

items.title: Australia's women beaten by New Zealand in Perth Sevens final, but men claim bronze
items.summary: The Australian women are forced to settle for silver at the Perth Sevens, while the Aussie men claim bronze in thrilling fashion.

items.title: Businessman and bad gambler Sam Kanjo linked to Australia's biggest illegal tobacco fine
items.summary: He's been declared bankrupt repeatedly, and was a gambling addict. Now he's linked to a $1.5 million fine for illegal tobacco.

items.title: Why Payne Haas's move from Brisbane to South Sydney changes the game for two NRL giants
items.summary: Payne Haas's decision to leave Brisbane for South Sydney in 2027 didn't just shock the rugby league world, it transformed the futures of two of rugby league's most powerful clubs in an instant.

items.title: Australia's Diamonds smash Jamaica again to seal three-game series in Perth
items.summary: Kate Moloney celebrates her 50-game milestone in style as the Australian Diamonds post a 32-goal victory over an understrength Jamaica in Perth.

items.title: Thailand PM Anutin Charnvirakul confident of forming government after election
items.summary: South-East Asia's second-largest economy went to the polls on Sunday in a tight race between conservatives aligned with the military and the monarchy, and progressive elements represented by the reform-driven People's Party.

items.title: $740m veterans plan to fund social 'rehabilitation' and psychedelic treatments for PTSD
items.summary: A $740 million program will expand support for veterans and include funding for social activities such as yoga and language classes, with new treatment including MDMA and psilocybin for the worst forms of PTSD also funded for the first time.

items.title: Japan PM Sanae Takaichi leads coalition to landslide election victory
items.summary: Sanae Takaichi's Liberal Democratic Party and its coalition partner are expected to hold upwards of two-thirds of the seats in Japan's lower house.

items.title: UK prime minister's chief of staff Morgan McSweeney quits amid Epstein fallout
items.summary: Sir Keir Starmer's leadership is under threat after revelations that one of his former US ambassadors had close ties with Jeffrey Epstein.

items.title: Young people could get massive pay boost in 'totemic' wage case
items.summary: "I'm paying adult fuel with still a child's wage," says Ben Walker, one of the almost half a million young people who could see a huge boost to their wage.

items.title: Five simple steps to saving cash (while still having a life)
items.summary: Saving money is not about beating yourself up. It's also not about depriving yourself of all sources of joy.

items.title: The Tasmania Devils start selling memberships later this month — how will they work?
items.summary: The Tasmania Devils will start signing up members later this month, but there's some confusion about what is required to secure a seat for AFL games in 2028. Here's how it will work.

items.title: Telstra mobile tower sparks backlash in St Helens despite poor phone coverage
items.summary: It's known for fishing boats, a pristine coast, a skyline without a high-rise in sight — and notoriously patchy phone reception. So, a new phone tower would be welcome, you'd think.

items.title: Coalition's rushed reunification does not solve their respective branding problems
items.summary: The Coalition has reunited, but the new agreement does not address underlying party tensions nor the surging fragmentation of the right.

items.title: One Nation capitalises on anti-immigration sentiment in a housing crisis
items.summary: Pauline Hanson might not have any substantive policies, but her rhetoric about reducing migration is clearly finding an audience.

items.title: Lindsey Vonn's horror crash at the 2026 Winter Olympic Games was always on the cards
items.summary: Lindsey Vonn's shocking downhill crash at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games was always a possibility given the American was competing just nine days after rupturing her ACL. But it was never going to stop her from trying.

items.title: Danish people using apps to help boycott American goods over Greenland
items.summary: After Donald Trump's repeated threats to acquire Greenland, many Danish people felt powerless but new apps are helping them make choices to boycott US-made products.

items.title: Two Australians reach big air final after tense qualifying runs
items.summary: Olympic medallist Tess Coady and fellow Australian Meila Stalker reach the snowboard big air final, after a dramatic day where American superstar Lindsey Vonn crashes in women's downhill.

items.title: SA Liberals promise new stamp duty concessions, Labor tackles aged care bed backlog
items.summary: Less than six weeks from the South Australian election, the Liberal Party has announced an election promise on stamp duty while the Labor government unveil its plan to create 1,300 new aged care beds.

items.title: Police recover pilot's body from croc-infested marsh after Normanton plane crash
items.summary: Police officers armed with rifles guarded their colleagues while they recovered the man's body from the crash site in difficult terrain near Normanton, in the Gulf of Carpentaria.

items.title: WA photographers reminisce about bygone Goldfields era as gold's price surges
items.summary: In 1989, two photographers travelled from Fremantle to Western Australia's Goldfields to capture the end of a gold mining era.

items.title: In the Australian outback, we're listening for nuclear tests. What we hear matters more than ever
items.summary: As the New START treaty curbing the US and Russian nuclear weapons programs expires, the work we do here in the red centre has become more important than ever before.

items.title: Tasmanian government says illegal tobacco sales crackdown will deliver some of the 'toughest' laws in the country
items.summary: The Tasmanian government announces increased penalties for those caught selling illegal tobacco products.

items.title: Payne Haas quits Brisbane to sign three-year deal with South Sydney Rabbitohs
items.summary: South Sydney have pulled off one of the biggest recruitment moves in NRL history after signing Brisbane enforcer Payne Haas to a three-year contract from 2027.

items.title: Search effort winds down for missing Gold Coast fisherman
items.summary: The cross-border search for a 44-year-old fisherman missing off the Gold Coast for three days has been scaled back and transitioned into a recovery phase after his boat and EPIRB were found but there were no signs of life.

items.title: Palestine Action Group takes court action against extra police powers ahead of protests against Israeli president's Sydney visit
items.summary: The Palestine Action Group lodged submissions late on Sunday afternoon, arguing the declaration was "draconian" and imposed rules unsuitable for protest activity.

items.title: Piper James's parents say dingo management reform needed to prevent further deaths on K'gari
items.summary: Piper James's parents are leaving Australia with their daughter's ashes and a determination to ensure she hasn't died in vain.

items.title: Man dead, five others hospitalised after Sydney's Dreamstate music festival
items.summary: Several people suffered "medical episodes" at the trance music festival at Sydney's Olympic Park, according to police.

items.title: Why young people say they are not the only ones hooked on screens
items.summary: The focus of discussion around screen time is on teenagers and young adults, but young people say they are noticing older people are in the grips of their devices too.

items.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 2, Sunday, February 8
items.summary: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan today.

items.title: Equine photography in demand in Australian performance horse industry
items.summary: From leaf blowers to dance moves, photographers use every trick they can think of to get the perfect shot for the biggest performance-horse sale in the southern hemisphere.

items.title: Jim Chalmers says next federal budget will focus on lifting economy's 'speed limit'
items.summary: Treasurer Jim Chalmers says the federal government's budget in May will focus on productivity, spending restraint and tax reform.

items.title: Savannah Guthrie indicates she will pay ransom for return of her mother in video message to apparent kidnappers
items.summary: In a video posted to Instagram, the host of NBC's Today Show appears to directly address her mother's kidnappers, telling them she and her siblings have "received your message, and we understand".

items.title: Train delays in Italy during Winter Olympics opening weekend after damage
items.summary: Police are investigating three incidents of damage on lines around Bologna, and have not ruled out a potential link to the Milan Cortina Games.

items.title: 3 Doors Down frontman Brad Arnold dies after stage four cancer battle
items.summary: Brad Arnold, a founder and the lead singer of American rock band 3 Doors Down, dies nine months after revealing he had kidney cancer.

items.title: Korean cryptocurrency exchange accidentally gives away $60b in bitcoin
items.summary: A South Korean cryptocurrency exchange apologises after mistakenly transferring more than $60 billion worth of bitcoin to users, which briefly prompted a sell-off on the platform.

items.title: New Hobart zip-line proposal for public land, but this one wouldn't be on Kunanyi/Mount Wellington
items.summary: Another zip-line is being proposed for public land near Hobart, almost a year after the last proposal on Kunanyi/Mt Wellington was knocked back by the Hobart City Council.

items.title: Valentino Guseli missed out on a bonus 2026 Winter Olympics medal, but won something even more important
items.summary: It was 18 months ago that Valentino Guseli blew out his ACL attempting a backside 1800 at the Beijing big air. At the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics snowboard big air final, he put that ghost to rest.

items.title: Before opening Meg's Bookshop in 1991, the Arnolds were told kids 'didn't read' in Port Pirie
items.summary: In one of Australia's most disadvantaged regions, more known for its lead than its literature, a couple wanted to open a book store but were told children didn't read books there. They did it anyway, and it went on to become a "world class" institution.

items.title: Man arrested after suspicious Maidstone church fire
items.summary: A man is due to be questioned by police after a church in Melbourne's west caught fire in the early hours of this morning.

items.title: Heat and fires expose ancestral remains in Victoria's north-west
items.summary: Ancestral remains that could be thousands of years old have been uncovered by erosion, dust storms and bushfires in Victoria.

items.title: Coalition reunited after last-minute deal
items.summary: The Liberals and Nationals have reached a breakthrough deal to reunite the Coalition after 11th-hour talks.

items.title: New hope for national gun register 30 years after it was first proposed
items.summary: First proposed after the Port Arthur massacre in 1996, Australia still doesn't have a national gun register. As Queensland parliament sits for the first time since national gun reforms became law, advocates say it is time to centralise firearm information.
